qandaentry.question: Are packages available for my Linux distribution?
qandaentry.answer: Many common Linux flavours are catered for over at the SuSE Build Service. Try there.

qandaentry.question: Why is Aten's main view on is corrupt/black on my Mac/Windows/Linux machine?
qandaentry.answer: This is, sadly, a fairly common issue, and the exact cause(s) is (are) not known for sure. Certainly on some Linux machines the presence of an ATI graphics card seems to be related. Using the 'radeon' or 'fglrx' drivers supplied with the OS rather than the proprietary 'ati' driver sometimes helps. On any platform, forcing the main view widget to manually refresh itself also often helps, particularly on the Mac. To do this, type in 'aten.prefs.manualswapbuffers = TRUE;' in the command toolbar (or supply it with the '-c' switch on the ((The Command Line|command line)).

qandaentry.question: ./autogen.sh: line 35: libtoolize: command not found
qandaentry.answer: You need to install the 'libtool' package - it should be on the original CD of your linux distro or on one of the billions of repository mirrors around the world.

qandaentry.question: Error: 'uic: File generated with too recent version of Qt Designer (4.0 vs. 3.x.x)'
Error: 'This file was generated using the moc from 3.X.X. It cannot be used with the include files from this version...'
Error: Can't find 'libtoolize'
qandaentry.answer: It is possible that ./autogen.sh will complain that it can't find 'libtoolize'. How to fix it?

qandaentry.question: Error: Possibly undefined macro: AC_DEFINE
qandaentry.answer: When running ./autogen.sh, autoconf sometimes fails with 'configure.ac:16: error: possibly undefined macro: AC DEFINE'. This is related to the version of pkg-config you have installed (e.g. version 0.15.1 gives this error, but version 0.21 does not) with Fink / MacPorts. Upgrade to the latest version. Incidentally, the line-number reported (16) is not the actual location of the error - autoconf reports this wrongly (the actual error occurs later on with the `PKG CHECK MODULES(GTK28, ..., [AC DEFINE...' command).

qandaentry.question: Warning: Underquoted definition of PKG_CHECK_MODULES
qandaentry.answer: Running ./autogen.sh, aclocal complains '/sw/share/aclocal/pkg.m4:5: warning: underquoted definition of PKG_CHECK_MODULES' If pkgconfig is not installed this is likely to give rise to the said spurious error. Install pkgconfig from Fink / MacPorts to proceed.

qandaentry.question: autogen.sh appears successful, but aclocal complains about 'underquoted definition of AM PATH...'
qandaentry.answer: These warnings should not have affected the generation of a working ./configure script. So you may as well move on to the next step.

qandaentry.question: Undefined reference to ___stdoutp expected to be defined in /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib
qandaentry.answer: Chances are you have an 'old' operating system - Panther (10.3.9) is confirmed to show this error. Since the Universal Mac binaries are built on a machine with Leopard (10.5) this error can only be avoided by upgrading your operating system or compiling Aten by hand.
